intro: Thamnochortus arenarius, commonly known as the sandberg's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal, aiding in its propagation across open habitats. Thamnochortus arenarius is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
